meanings.definition: Elaborate or intricate in design or construction.
meanings.sent1: The fancy dress had many sparkles and frills.
meanings.sent2: She wore a fancy necklace to the party.
meanings.sent3: The fancy cake looked too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent4: The fancy mansion stood out among the simple houses.
meanings.sent5: The fancy car gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To have a particular liking or desire for.
meanings.sent1: I fancy chocolate ice cream over vanilla.
meanings.sent2: He fancies going for a walk in the park.
meanings.sent3: She fancies the idea of a cozy night in with a good book.
meanings.sent4: They fancy exploring new places and trying new foods.
meanings.sent5: Do you fancy watching a movie tonight?

meanings.definition: To imagine or think something without evidence.
meanings.sent1: I fancy I saw a shooting star last night.
meanings.sent2: She fancies that she will win the lottery one day.
meanings.sent3: He fancies himself as a great chef, but he burns everything he cooks.
meanings.sent4: They fancy they can fly if they jump high enough.
meanings.sent5: Do you fancy that aliens exist in outer space?
